column1: #Text=m -2- Mommsen an Brunn 16. April 1846 But when I sat in the calessine And long the road the budding wine , Saw with the trees first green entwine , When from fair Terracina 's height The glorious ocean turned to sight , The bluest devils then gave way Before the genial month of May - .

#Text=Who calls it April , he is wrong , For May it is in northern tongue , The montk of love , the month of song , The olive 's everlasting leaf O'erhangs the green fielä fair and brief \; Dashes along the sparkling rile , Greeting the valley from the hile \; With joy and life each hamlet teens , A bridal-bed the country seems , Reminding of the Persians tale , How was courted the rose by the nightingale .
#Text=But , dearest Brunn , what 's that to You ?
#Text=My boon companion though thou art , Whom I do love with all my heart , In every language , every clime , In honest prose and doggrel rhyme .
#Text=Write english still , though you ca n't spell , Slay Roaul - Rochette and fare you well ,
